website_summaries.verdict: KastKing’s inexpensive spinning rod is a surprisingly solid model, especially when you consider its featherweight design, sensitivity, and rugged construction.
pros: Available in a wide range of sizes
cons: This spinning rod is only available in this black and green design, but it looks slick

customer_reviews.title: The Ultimate UL Rod for Pan fishing!
customer_reviews.text: WOW super light! the rod is pretty solid and is very well made! This will be a very good rod for pan fishing and also trout fishing!
customer_reviews.author: raWr Fishing

customer_reviews.title: KastKing makes great rods
customer_reviews.text: This rod has EASILY become my favorite light setup rod. I'm now ALSO looking at getting the MH one for larger bass and potentially walleye. I've caught more fish in the last couple of days with this rod because of it's sensitivity. More so, it also has a great impact transference through the blank and really lets you feel everything. This rod looks well built, and seems surprisingly sturdy for being so light and thin.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin-scott "Catterman" van Vlijmen

customer_reviews.title: This rod is super sensitive!
customer_reviews.text: I Have used this rod for walleye this early spring and it works great! I have amazon prime so the rod arrived in 2 days, everything was great no damages or anything out of the ordinary. It comes in 2 pieces for easy travel. Although its great for fishing the silver with the green lining makes it a great looking rod all around. Definitely would recommend this for anyone who fishes for Walleye, Small mouth, trout or any finesse small bite fishing!!!
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: SO MUCH FUN in a little package!
customer_reviews.text: So excited for these rods for MANY reasons. 1. I want to sightcast a redfish on the small 4foot version. 2. These are the perfect rods for little ones! Not only that but adults can still use them too! Really looking forward to testing these out more. Fish pics and shipping container pics attached. Thanks KastKing for the affordable and innovative products!
customer_reviews.author: nicole t coovert

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Ultra-Light Rod!
customer_reviews.text: I have been waiting for KastKing to come out with an ultra-light rod, it was worth the wait! KastKing definitely delivered with the Calamus. One of my favorite types of fishing other than bass fishing is pan fish fishing. I've tested this rod out and it's fantastic. Fighting even small fish on this rod is so much fun without feeling like I'm going to break the rod.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Yanez

customer_reviews.title: I can’t believe how light!
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic Ultralight ! This rod is so extremely sensitive yet has such a backbone to it! I loved it so much I had to order two more in different sizes! I’ve already caught many perch and Croppie and even big bass on this rod. If you love panfish, Croppie or perch fishing I highly recommend this rod. I can tell ou from experience that this rod can also land a big sized fish with no problem. So if your panfishing and you hook up into something in the 5+ lb range you will have no worries in landing it !
customer_reviews.author: Nikki FishingGirl

customer_reviews.title: amazing light for the price
customer_reviews.text: rod works amazingly, great sensitivity and just all around amazing. It's fun, light and make fishing exciting, while being able to cast quite some distance on it update November 26th: Ok this love affair did not last long and at this point in time, it just a constant irritation that the reel always comes loose and I'm about to use some electrical tape, to increase the friction of it, which hopefully makes it usable.
customer_reviews.author: berlinguyinca

customer_reviews.title: **** Low quality **** 4'6 model
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on purchasing this rod for the second time and was disappointed to open the shipping tube and remove the rod to find out once again the guides aren't straight just like the first one I ordered and also this rod which was the exact same model had a significantly softer tip and was crooked. I emailed kastking and was assured that kastking "rod has gone thru strict quality control". I'll never buy Kastking products again nor would I recommend helping the sales of this rod series. See pic for false product info. Rod says 1-4 card says 1-14
customer_reviews.author: Orencia

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved this fishing rod. I had it paired up with a Cadence 1000 series reel, with 6 lbs test line. It was my go to panfish combo. I caught a boat load of fish using a slip bobber with this rod. An then one day after landing 3 catfish in the 2-3 lbs range. The rod snapped. It broke 4 inches above where to the 2 piece rod goes together. Talk about heart break. Looks like only 1 piece rods for me from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey C.

customer_reviews.title: This seems like a well made rod but I had to return ...
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a well made rod but I had to return it for 1 simple reason. The placement of the metal clip where you would clip your hook into is positioned on the bottom, therefore, whenever I cast it the line will get stuck on the hook. If the metal clip was placed on the side or top this wouldn't happen.
customer_reviews.author: Keith T. Cheung

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight rods, easy casting
customer_reviews.text: These rods are listed as ultralight but this refers mostly to their weight, not power. They go up to 7’ MH. I bought 2, a 6’6” light for Ned rig fishing and 7’ medium (fast tip) for light inshore saltwater fishing. I fished the 6’ and love the action. It will cast a 1/15 Ned rig easily. Testing the 7’, it will cast small plugs like a rocket. Can’t wait to try it when the weather warms some. Great rods. Note: as mentioned the ferrels aren’t designed to meet so don’t try to jam pieces together. They feel like a one piece rod though.
customer_reviews.author: GA

customer_reviews.title: I don't like it.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for one brand of rod to replace all of the rods I had acquired over the years so I bought a medium light 6ft to try out. My search is apparently not over. My biggest complaint is that the reel wiggles. I have it tightened as tight as it will go. I've taken it off and put it back on and it is still loose. I showed it to my Nephew to see if he thought it was as bad as I did and he said to send it back right away. Probably not worth the time and effort to ship it back. First time I bought a rod over the internet unseen and probably the last.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Great pole
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy with this rod. I was fishing next to my dad fishing with the absolutely identically the same set up except for the pole. He was using an extremely lightweight rod while I was using a bass rod. He kept pulling fish out with almost every cast while I couldn’t even feel a bite. He told me to get a lighter rod and I had no idea it would make that much of a difference but it does. Now i can almost keep up with him and I feel every bite
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: It's just OK
customer_reviews.text: Having used it a few times now, I have one complaint and a general comment. The lower handle screws to the right in order to clamp the reel in the mount. It constantly comes loose as I cast and that becomes pretty annoying after a few hours of constantly tightening it again and again. Also, the rod is surprisingly stiff for it's rated action. The rod is every bit as light weight as advertised and that is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Jon P.

customer_reviews.title: Super Fun Ultralite
customer_reviews.text: I have the 5', 2 pc ultralite and really enjoy using it. It casts spinners great and is very sensitive for live bait situations. I'm not crazy about the reel seat but really like everything else about this rod. Perfect rod for trout and panfish. With a rod this light, IM7 provides a nice blend of sensitivity and strength in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Steelhead

customer_reviews.title: Very light
customer_reviews.text: This is one on the nicest rods I have ever purchased. I put it with a kastking summer 500 reels for a crappie rig set up. I look forward to trying it out. It balances extremely well. The balance point is at the front of the reel seat. It’s going to be fun to use I don’t think I will wait till spring might have to try some bluegill just to play with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kameron

customer_reviews.title: Great at first!
customer_reviews.text: Was a great pan fishing rod until the tip snapped under very low load on a small brim. Only got to use the rod 10 times top. I was using the ultralight 4'6 rod with a Kast king spinning reel with 4lb test line with a worm and #8 hook with the drag set appropriately for the line weight. Felt the bite attempted to set the hook and SNAP right at the tip past the second to last guide.
customer_reviews.author: Greyfox529

customer_reviews.title: Great for trout
customer_reviews.text: Used this for the first time on a recent trip to the Colorado mountains. It handled brookies, browns and rainbows from 4 - 26" no problem. Paired it with a Mela II and turned out to be an awesome combo.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Haber

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome compact rod. I am super excited to catch some Crappie on this rod. I got the 4'6" ultra light one piece rod. Grips are comfy and I love the color of the rod. KastKing has done an awesome job developing this setup. I paired with a sharky 2 1500 reel. Awesome combo.
customer_reviews.author: Seth L

customer_reviews.title: Love this rod!  My dedicated Ned Rig setup.
customer_reviews.text: Featherlight while still having plenty of backbone. I’ve had a ton of fun using it for finesse applications and have caught plenty of bass. I have a Piscifun Carbon X reel on it, feels perfectly balanced. The only issue I’ve had is it the reel did not feel tight, but after adding a little craft foam sheet it seemed to do the trick. Not sure if the rod or the reel is to blame for that but I would buy it again for sure because finish is top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Kclovtx

customer_reviews.title: Classy Ultra Light
customer_reviews.text: Recieved this rod a few days ago and it showed up well packaged and in great shape. This Ultra Light is classy, looks and feels great. I haven't caught any monsters on it but have caught some sunfish and small bass and it feels just right.
customer_reviews.author: Out West with Chris

customer_reviews.title: Strong & Super light
customer_reviews.text: This is a 2pc ultra light rod but I have pulled out some nice size red drums & flounders out of the water with it. I know I am using it for more than it's meant for but it's such a great little rod I can't help it lol
customer_reviews.author: Ruben R

customer_reviews.title: Forgot It Was 2 Pieces
customer_reviews.text: When you put it together, you kind forget it was made of two pieces. It's incredibly light and easy to cast with. Unfortunately, I haven't caught anything. The rod's not at fault mind you, I seem to just be a fish repellent.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far...
customer_reviews.text: Fished it five times. So far, so good. Was a bit concerned with durability, but have landed an eight and a half pound, a ten and a quarter, and several one to four pound bass with it, with no problems. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: BWD

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels great
customer_reviews.text: Impressive look and feel. Light action is panfish appropriate, bass may be a challenge with such a light action. I would rate this as a med/fast tip upon initial inspection I will update the review after some use
customer_reviews.author: BrentSte

customer_reviews.title: OH WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Incredible! ULTRA Light ULTRA Strong! I'm going to order 2 more size. Perfect for the lighter end of my fishing rod aresenal. I tried it out and did some tests - this rod has much more capacity than you think. Beautiful workmanship too. Love the finish.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence McDonough

customer_reviews.title: Honestly not happy with it at all
customer_reviews.text: Honestly not happy with it at all. Bait got taken by a 3 pound large mouth and snapped the tip on my first time even trying the pole out. Waste of 60 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Nowaczyk

customer_reviews.title: Does Kastking have a Quality Control department?
customer_reviews.text: Broken! Defective right out of the box. Would not have made it through the first cast. Either this one slipped through Quality Control, or Kastking produces inferior equipment. Purchased this brand based on reviews from certain YouTube personalities. To say I’m extremely disappointed is an understatement. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Photog Mama

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Nice feel to the rod used with KastKing reel and good value. Seems to be made with good components and time will tell as far as durability.
customer_reviews.author: Psorcon

customer_reviews.title: Light, stiff but sensitive
customer_reviews.text: I paired it with a centron 500 and 6lb braid. Took it to the canals and caught a ton of bluegill and even a pretty big bass. It is sensitive, but not flimsy like the Shakespeare micro series I used before it, it bends smoothly. The handle is different, it's as thick as the rod blank with a couple little foam sections but it fits comfortably enough in the hand. I'd reccomend it over all the cheaper ultralight you get at walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Go to rod..
customer_reviews.text: My current go to rod for bass fishing. Never been a fan of a 2 piece but this Calamus rod has the backbone of a 1 piece. Super light but sturdy enough to pull in big boys. Feels good in the hands..
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Caulder

customer_reviews.title: Buy it. Do it. Do it now
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well made rod. I can’t say enough good about it. I got the ultralight one piece and paired it with a pflueger president size 20 reel and its the best setup I have. I catch everything from sunfish to bass on this light setup. Don’t hesitate buy it. You will love it.
customer_reviews.author: ethan garrett miller sr

customer_reviews.title: Favorite ultralight!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic rod! I have it paired up with the KastKing Kodiak!! Another great product and I'm very excited to finally have a KastKing ultralight setup! Been crushing snook with it already!
customer_reviews.author: Gabe Feltman

customer_reviews.title: Tip broke on first fish...the other 1 delivered crushed upon delivery $250 all together
customer_reviews.text: Calamus rods have an appearance of a good rod, i have bought 2 very expensive both broke at the tip very first fish. You need to fix this problem because you stealing money from good people.. 3rd one never got to see.
customer_reviews.author: JohnSnow

customer_reviews.title: High quality with a low cost.
customer_reviews.text: This rod is truly ultra light weight. It's great for fishing with lighter tackle, due to being a medium-light. I am very impressed with this rod, especially given it's price.
customer_reviews.author: Jason D.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Ultra-Light that I've purchased yet
customer_reviews.text: My favorite Ultra-Light that I've purchased yet. I had first heard about it on Extreme Philly Fishing's YouTube channel. I've hit several trout streams with it and it's held up great against some pretty large trout this year. I would buy this again any day.
customer_reviews.author: Wyborn24

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great sensitivity, strong rod, great cast ability, paired with the valiant eagle. Caught many fish from the pier today.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Dethrow

customer_reviews.title: Great product and customer service!!
customer_reviews.text: Super light and strong rod. Also very comfortable. Had a problem with a broken rod guide on tip side(could of been damaged in shipping, not even sure) so I just asked for a rod guide to replace it but Kastking sent out another complete rod tip. Super happy!!!
customer_reviews.author: David Tran

customer_reviews.title: My favorite rod of all time
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite rod of all time. Fishing it in Canada right now. So light, throws a mile and very sensitive at the tip. Would like a little more of a handle but, then again, I love how light it is. Going to try a kastking reel next.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Smith

customer_reviews.title: Need Time
customer_reviews.text: Just got the polls. Seem to be what I thank they were when order. But need time to try. Ihe arrived yesterday afternoon and I get his request for info this morning. Try back in a couple of months
customer_reviews.author: Bill McWhirter

customer_reviews.title: Light, strong, and sensitive with an unbeatable price point and lifetime warranty!
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievably lightweight, with more than enough backbone for hard fighting smallmouth bass, the Kastking Calamus rod is a home run! The rod is sensitive enough to tell the difference between a soft bottom, grass, or rocks. Kastking has a winner with this rod, the pricepoint and features are unmatched by any competitor. I am a Kastking convert.
customer_reviews.author: Lee D. Sudduth

customer_reviews.title: A fun little rod to whip around
customer_reviews.text: I specifically bought this rod (6' - 2p - Light) for trout/panfish and paired it up with kastking 4lb fluorokote on a pflueger trion 20b. Pleasantly surprised at how well it handled pike, bass, & walleye. A fun little rod to whip around. I'd def recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tou Xiong

customer_reviews.title: Love kastking
customer_reviews.text: Switched from st croix to kastking, about 18 months ago. Wide eye and calamus, no regrets and every bit a good
customer_reviews.author: Chuck R

customer_reviews.title: FYI the medium heavy does a great job casting 1/4 ounce lures
customer_reviews.text: FYI the medium heavy does a great job casting 1/4 ounce lures! If you ran 20 pound braid I'd be willing to bet it would cast 1/8 pretty well too! Very versatile rod!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna S.

customer_reviews.title: Hooked
customer_reviews.text: Line kept getting hooked on the hook clip of pole when casting, hook too close to reel. It was returned
customer_reviews.author: Tim & Susan

customer_reviews.title: Only Ultralight you’ll ever need!
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is AMAZING. I’ve got it paired with a size 1000 Creed GT. Casts are smooth and this thing can LAUNCH small cranks and bobber rigs. It’s got quite the backbone considering how small it is. Fighting trout and big bluegill with this rod is insanely fun.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Kingswan

customer_reviews.title: Great little rod
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive,well made-the equal of any rod you can get for less than 200 dollars-excellent ultralight action I’ve been looking for,well made,pretty little rod.Not fragile at all compared to some ultralights. I recommend It strongly
customer_reviews.author: Charles Marcoe

customer_reviews.title: Light sleek and smooth!
customer_reviews.text: Damn this thing is very light! 2.5 onuces indeed! Feels really good in the hand. This will be perfect for a intermediate bass fishing and pan fishing as well for Creek fishing. I can not wait to try this beautiful looking pole out!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Super light and strong little rod...
customer_reviews.text: Love this 5' rod.. paired with a Daiwa Tatula 1000 spooled with 6# Seaguar Red. Perfect ultralight setup IMHO. Nice action... not whippy. This is my second one.. for my better half.. She loves it too. Price seems to be going up... get one.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Garvey

customer_reviews.title: Light as a feather but strong
customer_reviews.text: This is prob the lightest and most durable rod in the market extremely well designed
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: Light and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Amazing 2 piece rod. Got the ML for drop shots but I use it on the river for smallies too and it has awesome pulling power for such a light rod. Incredible sensitivity for an inexpensive 2 piece. I pair it with the KastKing Emerald eagle 2000 and it feels super high quality for a budget combo.
customer_reviews.author: kyle fillmore

customer_reviews.title: One of the best and funnest rods I own.
customer_reviews.text: The Calamus by far is one of the best rods I own.. Its really a fun rod the fish with as well.. Do not let the small size of this rod fool you.. This rod has plenty of back bone to land a 5+ pound bass.. This is a little powerhouse of a rod. I love mine.
customer_reviews.author: swampseeker

customer_reviews.title: It is good light rod
customer_reviews.text: I bought it when it was on sale with 50% off. So it is very good value. Very light weighted and sensitive. It is my go to rod for crappie and white bass.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice set up.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice ultralight rod. Fast action gives a little extra backbone. Very aesthetically appealing and well made. Good price point and value for the money. Paired with Kastking Emerald Eagle reel.
customer_reviews.author: Ted L

customer_reviews.title: Catches fish
customer_reviews.text: I love the feel of this rod. I've only been able to use it once. It caught me a couple fish. So for now all is well
customer_reviews.author: Renita Kitchingham

customer_reviews.title: Broken rod
customer_reviews.text: I only finished with it a few times i got stuck on a branch and while i try to shake off my tip snaps easily smh
customer_reviews.author: gabriel medina

customer_reviews.title: OK rod for price
customer_reviews.text: This rod has a good reel seat and decent guides. It isn't as light as I was hoping. I've had less expensive rods feel lighter and better... I'm more likely to experiment with a new brand/model when another ultralight need arises.
customer_reviews.author: Tony T.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Feels nice and light yet extremely durable looks great too super nice rod better than some $100 rods I’ve had
customer_reviews.author: Michael Estacio

customer_reviews.title: Great feeling light weight rod
customer_reviews.text: Wow,didn’t realize exactly how light this rod is! It’s super light but still has a great balanced feel to it. Got a KastKing Summer 500 reel to pair with it & can’t wait to use it with some Ned rigs. I got the 6’6” light action rod and it still has some backbone to it ( not too whippy ).
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Very light but broke an eyelet.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this fishing rod but one of the eyelets broke off reeling in a small fish the other day. I'll be seeing how the warranty process works and will edit my review once done. Very light weight though.
customer_reviews.author: 2010 Jeep

customer_reviews.title: Great but
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this rod. Great price and love the sensitivity.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholehmills

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid product.
customer_reviews.text: A beautiful rod at a great price. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One piece. Durable, strong. Good value for the price I paid (sale)
customer_reviews.text: Cool little rod. I paired it with a Zebco micro33 to use with grandkids, kayaking for Crappie and bluegill in the Spring.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Tip Broke
customer_reviews.text: Tip of the fishing rod broke off just while I was tying on a hook. Very little weight/pressure on the rod while I was tying looked up at it after I was done the tip was bend 90 degrees and came off completely when i touched it.
customer_reviews.author: kieran

customer_reviews.title: Great rod!
customer_reviews.text: I got the 5' Ultra-Light for Trout and Bluegills and have to say this is a fun rod to catch fish with. This thing is light and super sensitive. I also bought the 6'6 Light. I'd definitely recommend these rods!
customer_reviews.author: mbell

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great rod and I would recommend in the top 10 for ultra light rods
customer_reviews.author: Richard Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing rod
customer_reviews.text: Amazing rod extremely light I plan on buying a few more in different weights
customer_reviews.author: Robert Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Great all around ultra lightweight rod!
customer_reviews.text: A beautiful (if looks matter to you) ultra lightweight rod that can wrestle well above its weight class. I have a 2 piece 7ft for myself and a 1 piece 4ft that my daughter will be learning with.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher D.

customer_reviews.title: Great pole and fun fishing
customer_reviews.text: What can you say about Kastking? Every product they make it spot on magic! You will have a blast with pan fishing on this pole!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Corona

customer_reviews.title: nice ultra light rod
customer_reviews.text: really like the feel of this it is balanced just right.
customer_reviews.author: Gene H.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Handle came apart on second trip. That was an easy fix with gorilla glue. Tip snapped a year later. It was an okay rod but it's not worth the full price at 60 to 70 dollars. This rod was only used for casual pond fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great rod
customer_reviews.text: Have yet to actually take the rod out but did a few practice casts in the backyard and just like every other kastking item I own I love itRod was carefully packaged to prevent and damage while shipping. Would highly recommend to a friend. Have it paired with my Sharky II 1500, gum for scale.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: Love this rod. Stylish, durable, sensitive, what more could you ask for? Oh yeah, great value. So there you go, it's everything you could ask for.
customer_reviews.author: Justin walters

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it and really great gift to my husband. He is using right now at the tournament
customer_reviews.author: Linda Wang

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it caught 4 trout bought 4ft 6in rod super strong
customer_reviews.author: John Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, High quality, Pure Awesomness!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome rod extremely light purchased the 4' 6" model paired it with a shimano sienna 500 FG and love it. Kastking peace of mind warranty is awesome as well. A very happy fisherman after all!
customer_reviews.author: Parangaricutirimicuaro

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Loved mine. Bought my wife one too. Well designed. Quality built.
customer_reviews.author: Eli King

customer_reviews.title: Nice rod for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and as advertised in a durable tube.
customer_reviews.author: handy

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Mitchell 310pro reel. :(
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sleek and sexy rod. I love the action on it. My only complaint is that the reel mount does not close enough to accommodate my Mitchell 310pro reel.
customer_reviews.author: benjamyn hensley

customer_reviews.title: Big punch for a little guy
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and portable. Able to pull 12" rainbow from slack water creek. Dont highstick and you will land em.
customer_reviews.author: S. Nau

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: This rod has met all my expectations. This is my most used rod. Love to take hiking and use for trout. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Nice fishing rod
customer_reviews.text: I received the rod and wait no time to try it out. It is a very nice rod: light, balanced, feel effortless when casting it. I would recommend it to my fishing buddies.
customer_reviews.author: Fangming Huang

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a p.o.s. broke 1st time I went fushing
customer_reviews.author: athena

customer_reviews.title: Nice light rod!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice light rod. Perfect for my crappie fishing
customer_reviews.author: Docker

customer_reviews.title: It is light weight and feels excellent. I think it is even good for sand ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 7feet Med-Heavy rod for stripper,mackerel and ribbon fish ... It is light weight and feels excellent. I think it is even good for sand bass, crappie...
customer_reviews.author: wlz

customer_reviews.title: Smooth as Butter
customer_reviews.text: Paired this with Kastking Calamus 6"6 Spinning rod and, wow what a perfect combo! Light, fast, and Fluid. I couldn't be more satisfied. Kastking is my new go to for all of my gear.
customer_reviews.author: PhillyFisher07

customer_reviews.title: Nice action and light
customer_reviews.text: Use for drop shot and crappe nice and light mached with kasking 111 2000 very good and light and senatve
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This rod is super light and defiantly worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Christine W

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Strong and Sensitive!
customer_reviews.text: Well balanced rod has landed many panfish and the occasional bass and catfish. It's really been a fun rod to fish with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well-designed; Well-balanced; Very sensitive for all kinds of ...
customer_reviews.text: Well-designed; Well-balanced; Very sensitive for all kinds of bites; Light weight; Very reasonable price. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would not repurchase
customer_reviews.text: Good action,hard to cast, guides are cheapest on market good guides would solve casting issue
customer_reviews.author: Big E

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Love this rod. It's so easy to use for long periods of time due to how light weight the pole is. It feels odd using anything else now. I'm in love with it, and it handles large fish with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Light and sensitive!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about a two-piece rod. However, I had time to throw a few casts and WOW. I couldn't believe how light the rod was. I paired it up with a 1000 size reel and it feels great! I love the open reel housing! Grip is comfortable and the guides look great. The spigot connection feels very strong. Remember DO NOT try to force the two pieces all the way together, there will be a small gap by design. Overall very happy with this Ultralight!
customer_reviews.author: Devon Christian

customer_reviews.text: Is it normal for the connecting part to have a gap?
customer_reviews.author: Robert Pruess

customer_reviews.title: supposed to be red and black to match the reel ...
customer_reviews.text: supposed to be red and black to match the reel. It was a gift and the rod was green and black.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

product_meta.title: KastKing Calamus Ultra-Light Spinning Fishing Rods, Great for Crappie, Trout and Panfish, IM7 Graphite, Titanium Guides, Ultra-Light Reel Seats, EVA Handles & Fighting Butt, Split Rear Handle Design
feature_bullets: Ultra-Light IM7 Graphite Spinning Rods – KastKing Calamus spinning rods are designed from the ground up to be the lightest rods on the planet. We start with an ultra-thin, 30 million modulus, micro polish IM7 graphite blank that has a strain rate of 650K. These extremely light spin rods are perfect for crappie, trout, panfish, smallmouth bass and many other warm water species.

Premium Components – To keep weight to an absolute minimum while increasing sensitivity, we’ve used titanium guide frames and rings and weight reducing, 2-pc graphite reel seats. Comfortable, high density EVA perfectly wraps the handle and split fighting butt, providing perfect balance and comfort.

9 Ultra-Light Weight Spinning Rods – The KastKing Calamus fishing pole series is available in 9 models from an ultra-light 4’6” 1 pc rod that is perfect for panfish and small trout, all the way to a 7’ 2pc MH rod that will handle any trout, walleye or bass that swims.

Easy Travel and Storage with 2-pc Designs – With the exception of the short 4’6” 1-pc spin rod, all of the Calamus rods are design in 2-pcs. We use modified spigot ferrules which deliver exceptional performance and sensitivity and make travel and storage extremely easy.

Starting at 2.5 Ounces – With overall weights starting at just 2.5 ounces, these incredible new rods are perfect for ultralight or finesse fishing techniques. You won’t believe how light and powerful these rods are！
